intro: Bridelia micrantha var. micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bridelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
